posts.post_content: Mana Curve: 1 mana [Funeral Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Funeral Charm), 2 mana [Ravenous Rats](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ravenous Rats), 3 mana **Mind Rot**. There is beauty in this particular mana curve that WotC thankfully has not messed with through out the years.

posts.post_content: Saw somebody use this in a draft yesterday, both BG big creature decks. The board was completely blocked up with giant creatures, and the guy who ended up winning used this to make the loser discard his Overrun and Giant Growth.

posts.post_content:
For you 2010ers, nice combo with [Megrim](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Megrim) and [Sign in Blood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sign in Blood). Very fun in mono-black, only problem is don't try the combo if they have mana up, instants can screw with your combo.  
  
EDIT: worded badly, meant that it combines well with [Megrim](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Megrim)

Posted By: Tezz (4/24/2010 5:13:35 AM)
Rating:

@Tezz:
I think savage brain meant that this card is "way better" because if you prefer mono black then you can't use blightning. Obviously if you can splash red blightning is way better, but I think that card is undercosted anyway (same CMC as this card plus a free lightning bolt? the one R in the cost doesn't make it that much harder to play).

This card is perfect. If it did anything more for it's cost it'd be overpowered; as is it's balanced and is a nice way of making players drop cards. I always like to see their bigger bombs hit the graveyard when I play this on turn three and know that if the game makes it to turn 7 and I haven't won yet I'm not going to see them come back with their win condition.

Posted By: inmypants22 (8/24/2009 8:38:35 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
If you're wanting a B discard, splash in the red, give them some draw with [Sign in Blood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sign in Blood), [Howling Mine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Howling Mine), or [Font of Mythos](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Font of Mythos), then toss in your [Underworld Dreams](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Underworld Dreams) since you're pumping their hand up with some [Megrim](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Megrim) to trim. Then use your [Blightning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blightning) to nail them for 7 with the megrim, making sure they'll have a hand. Sure, there is definitely room for this card in discard, but if you're wanting to use Megrim to burn them as they discard, [Burning Inquiry](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Burning Inquiry) is infinitely better, it ensures they will have cards in hand, only costs 1 mana, and discards an extra. It will do 2 more damage, and only 1 less than Blightning.  
  
If anyone likes the deck idea, [Chandra Ablaze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chandra Ablaze) and [Liliana Vess](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liliana Vess) to taste.  
  
And for everyone crying about Blightning being undercosted, it doesn't tag on a [lightning bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=lightning bolt). Th... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
